intro: Psychotria cordifolia subsp. perpusilla, commonly known as the dwarf heartleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
